dataProtection.title: Data Protection
dataProtection.text1:
The protection of your personal data provided in the context of the use of our website is an important personal data provided in the course of using our website is an important concern for us. Therefore, we would like to inform you below about the nature, scope and purpose of the collection and use of data and the use of cookies within our internet offer and the data collection and use related data collection and use.

The responsible body within the meaning of the data protection regulations is the Evangelisches Werk für Diakonie and Development e.V., Caroline-Michaelis-Str.1, 10115 Berlin, Imprint (hereinafter referred to as "Diakonie Deutschland", "we" or "us".).
dataProtection.text2:
Our data processing is based on the applicable data protection standards, in particular the Church Act on Data Protection of the Evangelical Church in Germany (DSG-EKD).

The following designation as
dataProtection.users:
, includes our members, donors as well as the visitors of our online offers and is to be understood gender-neutral.

In addition to this data protection declaration, our Internet offer may contain further and more specific data protection notices, to which you will be referred separately.

We process users' personal data only in compliance with the relevant data protection provisions. This means that the user's data will only be used in the presence of a legal permission or the existence of consent.

We take organizational, contractual and technical security measures in accordance with the state of the art to ensure that the provisions of data protection laws are complied with and thus to protect the data managed by us against accidental or intentional manipulation, loss, destruction or against access by unauthorized persons.
dataProtection.text3:
Users' personal data will be used, in addition to the uses expressly mentioned in this Privacy Policy, for the following purposes:

  • The performance of our statutory tasks, execution of our services, services and user services;
  • Technical and business-related notifications regarding our offerings.

The personal data provided to us online will only be collected, processed and used for the purposes communicated in the specific case. Any further collection, processing or use will only take place in accordance with the law.

In this context, the processing is only lawful pursuant to Section 6 DSG-EKD if at least one of the following conditions is met:

  1. a legal regulation permits or orders the processing of the personal data;
  2. the data subject has given his/her consent to the processing of personal data concerning him/her for one or more specific purposes;
  3. the processing is necessary for the performance of the controller's tasks, including the exercise of ecclesiastical supervision,
  4. the processing is necessary for the performance of another task carried out in the interest of the Church,
  5. the processing is necessary for the performance of a contract to which the data subject is party or for the implementation of pre-contractual measures taken at the data subject's request;
  6. processing is necessary for compliance with a legal obligation to which the church body is subject;
  7. the processing is necessary in order to protect the vital interests of the data subject or another natural person;
  8. the processing is necessary to protect the legitimate interests of a third party, unless such interests are overridden by the legitimate interests of the data subject, in particular where the data subject is a minor.

We also transfer data to third parties if this is done on the basis of consent or if this is necessary for billing purposes (e.g., carrying out bank transactions or sending goods and invoices by post) or otherwise in order to fulfill our contractual obligations to users.

When contacting us, the information is stored for the purpose of processing the request and in the event that follow-up questions arise.

If the opportunity for the input of personal or business data (email addresses, name, addresses) is given, the input of these data takes place voluntarily.

Personal data is deleted if it has fulfilled its intended purpose and there are no retention obligations that prevent its deletion.
dataProtection.text4:
We reserve the right to change the privacy policy in order to adapt it to changed legal situations or in case of changes of the service as well as the data processing.

Users are therefore requested to inform themselves regularly about their content, especially if they provide personal information again.
dataProtection.text5:
You have the right to request information free of charge about the personal data that we have to receive information free of charge upon request.

You have the right to revoke your declaration of consent under data protection law at any time. (see also e.g. Newsletter). The revocation of consent does not affect the lawfulness of the processing carried out on the basis of the consent until the revocation. the revocation does not affect the lawfulness of the processing carried out on the basis of the consent.

In addition, in justified cases you have the right to rectification, to deletion, to restriction of processing, to data portability, as well as a right of objection against the processing.

The contact details are attached to the Imprint to take.

In the event of violations of data protection law, the data subject shall have the right to lodge a complaint with the competent supervisory authority. The competent supervisory authority is the

Beauftragte für den Datenschutz der EKD
Lange Laube 20, 30159 Hannover
Telefon: 0511 768128-0
https://datenschutz.ekd.de
dataProtection.text6:
If you have any questions regarding data protection, please contact the Data Protection Officer at Evangelical Work for Diakonia and Development:

Die/Der örtlich Beauftragte für den Datenschutz
Caroline-Michaelis-Str. 1
10115 Berlin
E-Mail: datenschutz@ewde.de
dataProtection.text7:
Cookies are pieces of information that are transferred from our web server to your web browser and stored there for later retrieval.
    Information may include, for example, your IP address or other identifier, your browser type, and information about digital content you interact with.
    By storing such information, web browser cookies can store your preferences and settings for online services and analyze how you use online services.
dataProtection.text8:
The use of technically necessary cookies serves to simplify the use of the websites for the website visitors. Some functions of our website require the use of technically necessary cookies. For this purpose, the user's browser must be recognized even after a page change. We collect data about every access to the server on which this offer is located (so-called server log files).

The legal basis for the processing of personal data using technically necessary cookies is § 6 No.4 DSG-EKD.

The access data includes the name of the website accessed, file, date and time of access, amount of data transferred, notification of successful access, browser type and version, the user's operating system, referrer URL (the previously visited page), IP address and the requesting provider. This data is not stored, but is available at runtime.

We use the log data without attribution to the person of the user or other profiling in accordance with the statutory provisions only for statistical analysis for the purpose of operation, security and optimization of the offer. However, we reserve the right to subsequently review the log data if there is a justified suspicion of unlawful use based on concrete indications. The user data collected through technically necessary cookies are not used to create user profiles.
dataProtection.title9: Duration of storage, possibility of objection and elimination
dataProtection.text9:
Cookies are stored on the user's computer and transmitted from it to our site.
    Therefore, you as a user also have full control over the use of cookies.
    By changing the settings in your Internet browser, you can disable or restrict the transmission of cookies.
    Cookies that have already been stored can be deleted at any time.
    This can also be done automatically. If cookies are deactivated for our website, it may no longer be possible to use all functions of the website in full.
dataProtection.title11: Registration and communication via the consulting platform
dataProtection.text11:
The advice portal is a closed and encrypted system through which people seeking advice can make anonymous contact with a Diakonie advice center.
    Diakonie Deutschland provides this system and ensures technical security, but has no insight into the counseling processes.
    These are the responsibility of the individual counseling centers.
    Therefore, if you have any questions about a counseling process, please contact the respective counseling center directly.
dataProtection.title12: Scope and purpose of data processing, legal basis
dataProtection.text12:
The goal of the counseling portal is to establish a level of confidentiality in online communication that is comparable to a one-on-one conversation within a counseling center.

Technically, it is ensured that consultation requests can only be read by the person seeking consultation and a consultant after the case has been distributed. It is not technically possible for third parties to read consultation content.

Counseling centers have the additional option of team counseling. All counselors of a team counseling center can view the counseling. This is indicated to the person seeking advice before the advice request.

In video counseling, a counselor can connect third parties, e.g. interpreters. The connection is visible to the person seeking advice.

To maintain mail server operation, for error diagnosis and to prevent misuse, mail server logs are stored for a maximum of 30 days. To ensure operation, to prevent misuse and for visitor evaluation, IP addresses of users are processed during the session. The IP addresses are not stored.

The legal basis for the processing of data is § 6 No. 2 DSG-EKD if consent has been given.
dataProtection.text13:
People seeking advice do not need to give their name, only a user name is required to identify the person(s) seeking advice. For this purpose, a freely selectable pseudonym can be used, which does not allow any inference to the actual name.

Advice seekers can also voluntarily enter their own e-mail address to which they will receive automated notifications as soon as a response to their inquiry is available. This e-mail address is not visible to consultants and no consulting content is ever sent to this e-mail address.

The IP address of advice seekers is not stored together with the request.

No user profiles are created that allow to connect different requests.
dataProtection.text14:
All messages of a request are automatically deleted 180 days after the last message. The "protection period" of 180 days ensures that an inquiry can continue even if it is interrupted for a few weeks by vacation or illness of the consultant or the person seeking advice.

Any documentation and archiving obligations remain with the consulting office.

confirmOverlay.copy:
This process cannot be reversed.

Your account will be deleted within the next 48 hours. Your data will be deleted in accordance with the applicable data protection regulations.

Please enter your password to delete your account now.

e2ee.hint: Your messages are encrypted end-to-end. That means no one outside this chat can read the messages. Not even the online consulting platform.

message.primary: A chat participant no longer has access to the message history.
message.secondary: A chat participant had temporarily lost access to the message history. Now all chat participants can access the message history again.

notice.title: Your security is important to us!
notice.text: Since you have reset your password, the messages are not readable for you at the moment. As soon as a chat participant opens the chat again, you can read the messages and write new ones.

overlay.headline: End-to-end encryption
overlay.copy:
Your messages are encrypted end-to-end for security reasons. That means no one outside this chat can read the messages. Not even the online consulting platform.

If the password is reset, the messages are temporarily unreadable. As soon as another chat participant opens the chat again, the messages can be re-encrypted. This means that all chat participants can read and write messages again.

imprint.text5: All images, photos, logos, texts, etc. used on our pages are subject to the copyright of the Evangelisches Werk für Diakonie und Entwicklung e.V. or third parties. They may not be used or may only be used after consultation with the editors. The various logos of the Diakonie and the crown cross are registered trademarks owned by the Evangelisches Werk für Diakonie und Entwicklung e.V. Unauthorized use and application is not permitted.
imprint.text6:
The contents of external links are carefully checked by us. Nevertheless, we assume no liability for the content of external pages linked to or from our website. The providers of these sites are solely responsible for their content.

Diakonie Deutschland is the umbrella organization for diaconia in Germany. As a Protestant welfare association, it is the social service of the churches in Germany and represents the interests of the people for whom the diaconal services and facilities are active. The online presence is therefore aimed at everyone who is interested in the services offered by Diakonie in Germany.

twoFactorAuth.title: Two-factor authentication
twoFactorAuth.subtitle: In addition to your password, use a second factor for logging in. This will provide additional security for your account.

step1.title: Select second factor
step1.copy: Install a suitable Authenticator app on your smartphone or tablet. Alternatively, you can also use your e-mail address as a second factor.
step1.visualisation.label: Selection

tooltip.app: Install the app. The app will generate a code for you to enter when you log in.
tooltip.email: You will receive an email with a code when you register. You must then enter this code.

input.label: Enter e-mail address

duplicate.label: E-mail address is already in use
duplicate.info: This email address is already in use by someone else. Please enter a different email address. Or use the app as a second factor.

input.info: You can only leave one email address with us. If you change the e-mail address here, you will also receive the notifications on this e-mail address in the future.

step2.title: Install the app

connect.key: Open the app and enter the following 32-digit key:

step4.visualisation.label: Link

label.short: The entered code is too short.

copy.1: They use this email address as a second factor for secure login.

copy.1: You cannot change your email address as long as you use it as a second factor for secure login.
copy.2: Change the second factor from "Email address" to "App". Then you can change your email address.

nag.title: Protect your account
nag.copy: Secure your account from possible unauthorized access. Use a second factor (app or email) to log in to the online fry.

moment.title: Protect your account no later than {{date}}
moment.copy:
You have to deposit up to {{date1}} a second factor (app or email) for logging into the online consultation. This is for security and protects your account from possible unauthorized access.

Attention: Without a second factor you are not allowed to consult online after {{date2}}.

obligatory.title: Protect your account now
obligatory.copy:
You now need to store a second factor for (App or E-mail) logging into the online consultation. This is for security and protects your account from possible unauthorized access.

This is for security and protects your account from possible unauthorized access.

unsupported.copy: Your device does not meet all the necessary technical requirements for a video call. Please follow these instructions to be able to start a video call. You may need the support of your IT department.

waitingroom.headline: Please be patient
waitingroom.subline: The video call has not yet started. You will be forwarded as soon as your consultant starts the video call.

paused.headline: The video call was ended
paused.subline: The video call has ended. If your consultant is only absent, you will be forwarded to the video call as soon as your consultant resumes the video call.

errorPage.headline: The video call was not found
errorPage.description: We cannot find a video call for your link because the video call has either been deleted or already terminated. If you still have problems, please ask your consultant.
errorPage.consultant.description: We cannot find a video call for your link because the video call has either been deleted or already terminated.

rejected.headline: You were not admitted
rejected.description: You have not been admitted. Unfortunately, you cannot participate in this video call because your advisor has not approved you.

walkthrough.title: Tour
walkthrough.subtitle:
To explain the individual functions, we have prepared a short tour for you
You can cancel it at any time or start it again in your profile.

0.title: Tour
0.intro:
To explain the individual functions, we have prepared a short tour for you.

They can cancel it at any time or start it again in their profile.

1.title: Initial inquiries
1.intro:
Here you will find an overview of all open requests that are not yet assigned to a consultant. Your entire team has access to this overview.

The oldest requests are at the top, the newest at the bottom, to make it easier for you to find the ones you received first.

The moment you click on 'Accept request', the request will be immediately moved to your 'My consultations' section and the other consultants will not see it anymore.

2.title: Live chat requests
2.intro:
From here you can start a chat with a person seeking advice who is currently in the waiting room.

Those seeking advice are identified by an anonymous name, such as "Advice Seeker 11".

If you want to start the chat, click on "Start chat" and you will be able to continue the conversation under the "My consultations" section.

3.title: My consultations
3.intro:
In this section you will find all the requests that you have accepted.

The message history that was last edited is at the top. If the person seeking advice is currently online in the waiting room, you will see the label "Active" right next to the name.

4.title: Archive
4.intro:
To avoid being distracted by conversations that are not active, you can archive some of the conversations.

They will then not be deleted, but only moved to the "Archive" tab.

Every time you or the advice seeker write something in an archived conversation, that message history is put back into the advice seeker list.

5.title: Team consultations
5.intro: In this section you can view and contribute to all active consultations that someone in your team is currently working on.

6.title: Profile
6.intro: In the profile area you can manage personal and public information, enable out-of-office messaging during your vacation, change your password and use many other features (like setting up 2-factor authentication).
